label: Description
value: Two parts of a stole, formerly joined, in blue-green and off-white. Design has small-scale palmettes framed by banded S-curves in off-white on a blue ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, linen Technique: two interconnected structures

label: Description
value: Light blue silk with white wefts bound in twill weave showing a symmetrical floral pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave, liseré

label: Description
value: Fragment of small panel, pieced, of red silk damask.  Small pattern of flower clusters in all-over asymmetrical design.  One selvage present.

value: Gift of Mrs. and Mrs. Milton I. D. Einstein

label: Description
value: Fragment of small panel, pieced, of red silk damask.  Small pattern of flower clusters in all-over asymmetrical design.  One selvage present.

value: Gift of Mrs. and Mrs. Milton I. D. Einstein

label: Description
value: Yellow damask showing parts of a long symmetrical repeat of foliage and large-scale plant forms.

label: Description
value: Purple damask with a large scale symmetrical floral ornament.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 5-harness satin damask damask

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 180 x 90 cm (5 ft. 10 7/8 in. x 35 7/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Sleeve embroidered in tightly spun black wool. Stylized flower and bird design, small doves carrying olive branches in their beaks.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen or cotton, wool Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Adam stands at left, Eve, right, with tree between.  Eve holds the apple, receiving it from the serpent.  Adam holds a branch of the tree in his right hand, bearing a parrot and tablet inscribed: ALBERTVS DURER NORICVS FACIEBAT.

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle.  From under a grey cloud, Venice extends along the curving bay, from the Doge's Palace, left, far beyond the Salute.  Occasional gondolas and other boats.

label: Description
value: Pale green Roman glass. A squat, bulbous body with tall, straight neck and horizontal rim. Iridescene mainly on interior.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Leo Wallerstein; 1961: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value:
fragment of yellow green glass
A) Elongated body tapering off, toward rounded bottom. Neck rising from body and terminating  in irregularly rounded lip. Pontil [?] mark on bottom.
B) Medal stand with three curved legs.
Ceiling Design for the Salone di Stupinigi (Main Hall of the Hunting Lodge)

label: Description
value: Ceiling decoration with sketches of figures, cartouches, and rounded designs.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and brown ink on off-white Turin paper

label: Provenance
value: Duke G. N. de Leuchtenberg, Russia; Edmond Fatio, Geneva [1]; Peter Josten; 1961: acquired by Museum                [1] Sold N. Rauch, Geneva, 3-4 June, 1959, no. 241 (no. 103)

label: Description
value: Cream colored linen textile showing the continents of America and Europe represented by text and iconographical figures of a Native American with arrow and European figure with horse.

label: Description
value: Futon cover with rice paste resist, hand drawn, and indigo dyed, on handspun cotton.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: hand-drawn rice paste resist, indigo dyed

value: H x W: 159 cm (5 ft. 2 5/8 in.)

value: Red ground printed with a design of large flowering vine and blossoms with characters from the Comedie dell'Arte.

value: Red ground printed with a design of large flowering vine and blossoms with characters from the Comedie dell'Arte.

value: Medium: linen Technique: relief printed on handwoven plain weave

value: Oblong panel of taffeta painted in polychrome with design of rocks, mountains, buildings. Part of a larger panel.

value: Medium: silk Technique: painted on taffeta

label: Description
value: Oblong panel of taffeta painted in polychrome. A landscape with trees, pavilion and rocks.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: painted on taffeta

label: Description
value: Fragment of a mantle with two wide bands of multi-color desigh of winged spear-bearer figure, set off by narrower bands of dark red. Design in shades of red, brown, green, blue and light yellow.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton warp, wool weft Technique: tapestry woven, single interlock; subtle use of non-horizontal wefts Label: cotton warp, wool weft, single interlock tapestry with some non-horizontal wefts

label: Description
value: A man is seen seated dejectedly at a table on which is a lighted lamp and a bowl. A woman, with her shadow enlarged by the light from the lamp, comes down a stairway in the rear. A cats eats from a bowl at the foot of the stairs.

label: Description
value: A drowning man clutches for a buoy. Overhead a raven flies in a spot of light. In the right distance, buildings on a rocky promentory.

label: Physical description
value: Pastel on paper, laid down on cardboard

label: Description
value: Textile with checkerboard desing of two alternating geometric patterns created in the weft ikat or kasuri technique. Pattern described as "seal script."

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: tied-resist patterning in weft (kasuri), indigo dyed, plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

value: Bookmark produced by B. B. Tilt & Son of New York and Paterson, NJ, made of woven silk with a portrait of George Washington, commemorating the American Centennial of 1876.

value: Medium: silk Technique: discontinuous supplementary wefts in a plain weave foundation

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Edward C. Moën
Frontispiece for Book 4, in Eight books of Ornament

label: Description
value: First book (dedicated to Lord Middlesex): title page and six plates, dated 1741, of rocaille cartouches; second book (dedicated to the Earl of Holderness): title page and five rocaille motifs, dated 1742; third book (dedicated to the Duke of Rutland): title page and six plates of cartouches, dated 1743; fifth book; title page and fourteen plates (one bound upside down) of furniture, dated 1743; sixth and seventh books: title pages (half-size) and fourteen plates of cartouches, undated; eighth book: title page and six plates of jewelery, dated 1747.

label: Physical description
value: Engravings on white laid paper, bound in half-calf and marbled boards

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
